meanings.definition: A stamp that is affixed to an envelope before mailing.
meanings.sent1: I put a prestamp on the envelope before sending it.
meanings.sent2: The prestamp on the letter showed a picture of a flower.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to play with the prestamp on the envelope, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a prestamp, brightening up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The prestamp with the image of a lighthouse reminded me of our trip to the coast.

meanings.definition: To affix a stamp to an envelope before mailing.
meanings.sent1: Please prestamp the letter before dropping it in the mailbox.
meanings.sent2: She always forgets to prestamp the envelopes, causing delays in sending out the invitations.
meanings.sent3: I prestamp the envelopes with care, making sure they are perfectly aligned.
meanings.sent4: His words prestamp the letter with sincerity and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The act of prestamping the envelope felt like sealing a secret with each stamp.
